result.text: Blanche Stuart Scott announced her intention to perform daring flights, showcasing her expertise and ambition as a pilot.
Mathilde Moisant participated in an aviation meet, impressing the audience with her pioneering spirit and skill.
Mathilde Moisant was celebrated for her daring flights, becoming one of the most renowned aviatrices of her time.
Blanche Scott and Mathilde Moisant were pioneers of aviation, inspiring others with their courage and skill in early aviation history.
Mathilde Moisant was featured in an article highlighting her significant contributions to aviation and her daring exploits.
Blanche Scott’s achievements in aviation were celebrated, highlighting her role as a pioneer in a male-dominated field.
Blanche Scott was featured for her incredible bravery and skill as an aviatrix, earning her admiration from peers and spectators alike.
Blanche Scott was celebrated as the "nerviest woman in aviation," showcasing her determination and skill in flying.
Miss Blanche Stuart Scott, one of the most daring aviatrices in America, participated in numerous meets and added hydro-aeroplanes to her aviation repertoire.
Miss Harriet Quimby, the first woman to earn a pilot’s license in the U.S., tragically died during an aviation meet where Miss Blanche Scott was also flying.
Blanche Stuart Scott witnessed and flew during the tragic accident involving Miss Harriet Quimby, showcasing resilience as the only remaining aviatrix at the meet.
Blanche Stuart Scott was featured as a star aviatrix at the Montana State Fair, thrilling audiences with her daring aerial performances.
Miss Scott shared her reflections on the death of Miss Harriet Quimby, reaffirming her commitment to the field of aviation despite the dangers.
